gurmukhi: jb jurq jMg ] nih murq AMg ] Air Bjq nyk ] nih itkq eyk ]98]
transliteration: Jab Jurat Jan|| Nah(i) Murat An|| Ar(i) Bhajat Nek|| Nah(i) Tikat Ek||98||
translation: When he fought, none of his limbs turned back; none of his enemies could stand before him and thus ran away.98.

gurmukhi: Qrhrq Bwn ] kMpq idswn ] mMfq mvws ] B`jq audws ]99]
transliteration: Thar-harat Bhaan|| Kanpat Disaan|| Mandat Mavaas|| Bhajjat Udaas||99||
translation: The sun trembled before him, the directions shivered, the opponents stood with bowed heads and would run away in anxiety.99.

gurmukhi: Qrhrq bIr ] BMBrq BIr ] qMqjq dys ] niRp mn nryS ]100]
transliteration: Thar-harat Beer|| Bhanbharat Bheer|| Tanndajat Des|| Nrip Man Daresh||100||
translation: The warriors trembled, the cowards fled and the kings of various countries would break before him like thread.100.

gurmukhi: cMcikq cMd ] DMDikq ieMd ] Pl gn PtMq ] BUA Dr BjMq ]101]
transliteration: Channdhakit Channd|| Dhandhakit Ind|| Phal Gad Phatant|| Bhooa Dhar Bhajant||101||
translation: The moon stood wonder-stuck in his presence; the heart of Indra throbbed violently; the ganas were destroyed and the mountains also fled away.101.

gurmukhi: jsu TOr TOr sBo sunXo ] Ar ibMdR sIs sBo DunXo ] jg jg swj Bly kry ] duK puMj dInn ky hry ]102]
transliteration: Jas(u) Thaur Thaur Sabho Sounyo|| Ar Bindra Sees Sabho Dhounyo|| Jag Jag Saaj Bhale Dare|| Doukhpounj Deenan Ke Dare||102||
translation: Everyone heard his praise at many places and the enemies, listening to his praises would become fearful and suffer mental agony; he removed the afficions of the poor by performing the Yajnas in a nice manner.102.

gurmukhi: ieiq jujwq rwjw kwl bs hoq Bey ]
transliteration: It(i) Jujaat Raajaa Kaal Bas Hot Bhae||
translation: End of the description about king Yayati and his death.

gurmukhi: AQ byn rwjy ko rwj kQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Ben Raaje Ko Raaj Kathanan||
translation: Now begins the description about the rule of king Ben

gurmukhi: puin byn rwj mhys BXo ] inj dMf kwhU qy n lXo ] jIA BwNq BwNq suKI nrw ] Aiq grb sB Cut aurDrw ]103]
transliteration: Poun(i) Ben Raaj Mahes Bhayo|| Nij Dand Kaahoo Ten A Layo|| Jeea Bhaant Bhaant Soukhinaraa|| At(i) Gadab Sabh Choot Urdharaa||103||
translation: Then Ben became the king of the earth; he never charged tax from anyone; the beings were happy in various ways and none had any pride in him.103.

gurmukhi: jIA BwNiq BwNiq bsy suKI ] qr diRSt Awvq nw duKI ] sB TOr TOr piRQI bsI ] jnu BUm rwj isrI lsI ]104]
transliteration: Jeea Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Bade Soukhee|| Tar Drisht Aavat Naa Doukhee|| Sabh Thaur Thaur Prithibasee|| Jan(u) Bhoom Rooj Sirilasee||104||
translation: The beings were happy in various ways and even the trees did not seem to have any suffering; there was praise of the king everywhere on the earth.104.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNq rwj kmwie kY ] suK dys srb bswie kY ] bhu doK dInn ky dhy ] sun Skq dyv smsq Bey ]105]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Raaj Kamaae Kai|| Soukh Des Sarab Basaae Kai|| Bahu Dokh Deenan Di Dahe|| Soun Dhakat Dev Samast Bhae||105||
translation: In this way, keeping all his country happy, the king removed many afflictions of the lowly and seeing his splendour, all the gods also appreciated him.105.

gurmukhi: bhu rwj swj kmwie kY ] isr AqR pqR iPrwie kY ] pun joq joq ibKY imlI ] Ar Cyn byn mhwblI ]106]
transliteration: Bahu Raaj Saaj Kamaae Kai|| Sir Atra Patra Phiraae Kai|| Poun Jot Jot Bikhai Milee|| Ar Chhen Ben Mahaabalee||106||
translation: Ruling for a very long time and getting the canopy swung over his head, the light of the soul of that mighty king Ben merged in the Supreme Light of the Lord.106.
